text: Stewart Wolfe Jamieson CBE (4 January 1903 – 4 May 1975) was an Australian diplomat, journalist, and lawyer. After attending The King's School, Sydney, Jamieson graduated from the University of Sydney with a Bachelor of Arts before studying law at the University of Oxford. He worked as a lawyer and journalist in the late 1920s and the 1930s, and enlisted with the Royal Australian Air Force in World War II. After the war, he joined Australia's diplomatic service. In a 20-year diplomatic career, he held a number of consular and ambassadorial posts, including as Australia's high commissioner to Ghana (1958–1960), ambassador to Brazil (1960–1962), ambassador to the Soviet Union (1962–1965) and Aabassador to Sweden (1964–1965). ==References== Category:1903 births Category:1975 deaths Category:Australian lawyers Category:Australian journalists Category:Ambassadors of Australia to the Soviet Union Category:Ambassadors of Australia to Brazil Category:High Commissioners of Australia to Ghana Category:Ambassadors of Australia to Sweden Category:Consuls-General of Australia in San Francisco Category:Australian Commanders of the Order of the British Empire Category:University of Sydney alumni Category:People educated at The King's School, Parramatta Category:Alumni of Balliol College, Oxford Category:20th- century lawyers Category:20th-century journalists
title: Stewart Wolfe Jamieson
